examples: I was right in the middle of a stretch when the phone rang.

definitions.definition: The ability to lengthen when pulled.
examples: That rubber band has quite a bit of stretch.

definitions.definition: A course of thought which diverts from straightforward logic, or requires extraordinary belief or exaggeration.
examples: It's a bit of a stretch to call Boris Karloff a comedian.
To say crossing the street was brave was quite a stretch.

definitions.definition: A segment of a journey or route .
examples: It was an easy trip except for the last stretch , which took forever.
It's a tough stretch of road in the winter, especially without chains.

definitions.definition: A segment or length of material.
A quick pitching delivery used when runners are on base where the pitcher slides his leg instead of lifting it.
A long reach in the direction of the ball with a foot remaining on the base by a first baseman in order to catch the ball sooner.
Term of address for a tall person.
The homestretch , the final straight section of the track leading to the finish.

subdefinitions.definition: Extended daylight hours, especially said of the evening in springtime when compared to the shorter winter days.
examples: There is a grand stretch in the evenings.

subdefinitions.definition: The period of the season between the trade deadline and the beginning of the playoffs.
A jail or prison term. ( slang ) A jail or prison term of one year's duration.
examples: He did a seven-year stretch in jail.

subdefinitions.definition: A single uninterrupted sitting ; a turn .

secondary_definitions: The ability to lengthen when pulled.

A segment of a journey or route .
A segment or length of material.

( baseball ) A long reach in the direction of the ball with a foot remaining on the base by a first baseman in order to catch the ball sooner.
